result.execSummary:
The defendant Patricia Kathryne Malone was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent to case 22CF2740; Counts 4, 7, and 8, with credit for 70 days served.

miscConds.notes: - Restitution to be determined on December 9, 2022.

-Court waives all non-mandatory costs due to inability to pay.
-All mandatory court costs, fees, assessments, and restitution to be paid, including DNA surcharge, during the period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

-No contact with victims; D.A., J.K.S., S.A., J.M.I., H.J.K., J.F.K.A., Katz Properties building at 1041 E. Knapp St., JETZ convenience store at 1425 N. Farwell Ave.
-No contact with firearms.

-Milwaukee Day Reporting Center; follow through and comply with any recommended treatment.
-Anger management; follow through and comply with any recommended treatment.
-Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications and follow through and comply with any recommended treatment. 
-Vocational Training.
-Provide DNA Sample

-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety; random urine screens and breathalyzers.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Patricia Kathryne Malone in court, in custody.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court for Patricia Kathryne Malone.  Attorney Dax Odom appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing hearing. Plea hearing proceeded.

AS TO COUNT 2.  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in to case for the purpose of sentencing. 

AS TO COUNT 1.  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, that a plea of guilty or no contest to the crime you are charged may result in deportation, exclusion from admission to this country, or the denial of naturalization under federal law is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty AS AMENDED and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

Sentencing proceeded. State has complied with victim notification. Statements by parties and defendant. Additional statement made by J.M.I.  

AS TO COUNT 1.  Court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, concurrent to case 22CF2740; COUNTS 4, 7, and 8, with credit for 70 days served. Court IMPOSED AND STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 3 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Serve 30 DAYS in House of Correction as Condition Time. Court IMPOSE AND STAYED; to be use as determined by agent;
-Milwaukee Day Reporting Center; follow through and comply with any recommended treatment.
-Anger management; follow through and comply with any recommended treatment.
-Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications and follow through and comply with any recommended treatment. 
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety; random urine screens and breathalyzers. 
-No contact with victims; D.A., J.K.S., S.A., J.M.I., H.J.K., J.F.K.A., Katz Properties building at 1041 E. Knapp St., JETZ convenience store at 1425 N. Farwell Ave.
-Vocational Training.
-No contact with firearms.
-Provide DNA Sample.
-Court waives all non-mandatory costs due to inability to pay.
-Restitution to be determined at a later date.
-All mandatory court costs, fees, assessments, and restitution to be paid, including DNA surcharge, during the period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.

Filed: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Plea Questionnaire/ Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights

Court ordered case adjourned for restitution hearing in Branch 36; IN PERSON. Restitution hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Elements for plea hearing; Received and Filed.

Defendant Patricia Kathryne Malone not in court, in custody.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court for Patricia Kathryne Malone. HEARING HELD OFF THE RECORD. Defense is requesting a plea and sentencing date. Case is adjourned in Branch 36.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Patricia Kathryne Malone appeared by video.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court for Patricia Kathryne Malone.  Attorney Dax Odom in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defense is requesting adjourned status date to determine case posture.  Court adjourns matter for a status conference. Case remains calendared in Branch 36.
Status conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Patricia Kathryne Malone in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Defendant Patricia Kathryne Malone in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Patricia Kathryne Malone appeared by video means with Attorney.  Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judicial notice of case #22CF2740. Sworn for the State: MPD Officer A Froh. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 36.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel.  Received and Filed.  nk

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with J M I
JKS; Katz Properties building at 1041 E. Knapp St., or within 500 feet of said building.
Alleged Victim Jason I appeared in court to address bail for dependant. Victim Witness Jenna also appeared in court.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Patricia Kathryne Malone in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Patricia Kathryne Malone in custody.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Patricia Kathryne Malone appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Crivello, Branch 36. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.   
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
